column1: @entity0 worked as a cook in a restaurant. For @entity2's Day, he made chocolate desserts. He tripled the recipe to feed all the people. He separated the eggs and measured the sugar. Then he melted the chocolate. He mixed the egg whites until they made a thick foam. He mixed the egg yolks with the sugar. But as he was ready to mix everything, his boss asked him to do a different job. @entity0 chopped some vegetables.  When he came back, @entity1 had taken over his work and made a mistake. The mix was much too thin. It looked like chocolate soup. It would not rise at all. Luckily @entity0 was ready. He had practiced the dessert recipe before. It looked like it did not have enough egg whites. @entity0 separated more eggs and mixed the egg whites. He added the extra egg whites to the mix. His addition worked. The desserts rose high in the oven. He saved the day!
how did @entity0 know how to fix the recipe and @placeholder did he do
he had practiced it before. he added egg whites.
he made @entity1 fix the recipe. @entity1 added egg whites.
he did not know how to fix the recipe. the desserts did not rise in the oven.
he had practiced it before. he added egg whites.
he asked the boss for help. the boss had him chop vegetables.
